For generations, preschoolers got their first taste of Broadway by listening to their parent's original cast recordings.
Now, Broadway is giving its regards to the pre-K set on cable television.
Two very popular series feature the music and lyrics of well-known and up-and-coming Broadway songwriters.

Testosterone is a hormone that promotes male characteristics, including musculature, libido, body hair - and eating food directly out of a pan over the sink when your family is away.
Human beings have hormonal changes at different stages of life.
Men preen, grow, scratch, and fan our feathers when we're young to attract a mate.
Some of the doctors involved in the study suggest that fathers - or any male caring for a child - may undergo hormonal changes to help them become more considerate, patient parents.
Northwestern anthropologist Christopher Kuzawa noted you don't need a lot of testosterone to have libido.
And a doctor at the Wisconsin National Primate Research Center says she's found that daddy marmosets also have lower testosterone counts.
They sire dozens of offspring.
